abstract_summ: Interventions: Patients were contacted before scheduled visits and triaged into: (1) patients eligible for the multidisciplinary telemedicine clinic, (2) patients to be seen in clinic urgently due to acute needs, and (3) stable patients who can be rescheduled at a later time.Implementation of telemedicine for patient encounters optimizes personal safety and allows for continuity of patient care.Conclusions: In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, implementing a telemedicine clinic process that serves the needs of a multidisciplinary care team is paramount to preserving the CF care model.During the present coronavirus disease (COVID-19) crisis, telemedicine has been recommended to screen suspected patients to limit risk of exposure and maximise medical staff protection.METHODS Patient demographics and appointment data (dates, visit types, and departments) were abstracted from the Electronic Health Record reporting database.
title_summ: Factors affecting the adoption of telemedicine during COVID-19.Onsite telemedicine strategy for coronavirus (COVID-19) screening to limit exposure in ED.Rapid Utilization of Telehealth in a Comprehensive Cancer Center as a Response to COVID-19.A Feasibility Study of Urgent Implementation of Cystic Fibrosis Multidisciplinary Telemedicine Clinic in the Face of COVID-19 Pandemic: Single-Center Experience.Rapid Utilization of Telehealth in a Comprehensive Cancer Center as a Response to COVID-19Telemedicine Platforms and Their Use in the Coronavirus Disease-19 Era to Deliver Comprehensive Vascular CareUse of Telemedicine and Virtual Care for Remote Treatment in Response to COVID-19 Pandemic
title_abstract_phrases: Interventions: Patients were contacted before scheduled visits and triaged into: (1) patients eligible for the multidisciplinary telemedicine clinic, (2) patients to be seen in clinic urgently due to acute needs, and (3) stable patients who can be rescheduled at a later time.The proportion of video visits increased from 7-18% to 54-68%, between the pre- and post-COVID-19 periods without any disparity based on race/ethnicity, primary language, or insurance Conclusions: In a remarkably brief period of time, we rapidly scaled the utilization of telehealth in response to COVID-19 and maintained access to complex oncologic care at a time of social distancing.Telemedicine Platforms and Their Use in the Coronavirus Disease-19 Era to Deliver Comprehensive Vascular CareImplementation of telemedicine for patient encounters optimizes personal safety and allows for continuity of patient care.METHODS Patient demographics and appointment data (dates, visit types, and departments) were abstracted from the Electronic Health Record reporting database.Rapid Utilization of Telehealth in a Comprehensive Cancer Center as a Response to COVID-19.BACKGROUND The emergence of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic in March 2020 created unprecedented challenges in the provision of scheduled ambulatory cancer care.
